definitions: The office of butler to a monarch, nobleman, etc. Frequently (and in earliest use) in "chief butlership". See "butler" and the note at that sense. Now chiefly historical.
The position of, or role occupied by, a butler, especially one in domestic service; the state of being a butler.

notes.text: In early use frequently with reference to Genesis 40:20–21, in which Pharaoh restores the royal cup-bearer to his former position.
